cognitive_assessment_tools.name: MATRICS Consensus Cognitive Battery
cognitive_assessment_tools.description: Most widely used tool for assessing cognitive impairment in schizophrenia. Developed as part of the MATRICS initiative (Measurement and Treatment Research to Improve Cognition in Schizophrenia).
cognitive_assessment_tools.advantages: Standardized and useful for both research and clinical practice.

cognitive_assessment_tools.name: Cognitive Assessment Interview
cognitive_assessment_tools.description: Semi-structured interview that assesses cognitive impairment based on patient and informant perception.
cognitive_assessment_tools.advantages: Considers subjective perspective of patient and their environment.

cognitive_assessment_tools.name: Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia
cognitive_assessment_tools.description: Brief and easy-to-administer test that measures cognitive impairment in a general way.
cognitive_assessment_tools.advantages: Administered in less than 35 minutes and has well-established norms.

cognitive_assessment_tools.name: Schizophrenia Cognition Rating Scale
cognitive_assessment_tools.description: Evaluates the functional impact of cognitive impairment based on information provided by the patient, an informant, and the evaluator.
cognitive_assessment_tools.advantages: Considers cognitive impairment in the context of daily functioning.

cognitive_assessment_tools.name: Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status
cognitive_assessment_tools.description: Although not specifically designed for schizophrenia, it is widely used to assess cognitive impairment in clinical populations.
cognitive_assessment_tools.advantages: Quick (20-30 minutes) and valid in schizophrenia.
